awd_titl_txt: SBIR Phase I: Solving the 4,023-year-old logistics control problem using modern IoT standards and a novel combination of passive RFID, UWB, cellular technology & their application
awd_abstract_narration:
The broader/commercial impact of this Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) Phase I project aims to revolutionize logistics and transport management via real-time visibility at the unserved serial number level through integration of wireless technologies. This research will enhance scientific and technological understanding by providing unprecedented insights into the movement of goods, thereby optimizing transport methods and materials. The market opportunity addressed by the proposed technology is vast, with a value proposition centered around real-time tracking, digital control empowerment, and reduced tracking costs. By leveraging precise on- and off-premise technology with Radio Frequency Identification (RFID), the solution promises to provide a durable competitive advantage. The technology will be offered at a reasonable monthly pricing per unit, unlocking commercial opportunities both domestically and globally. This novel approach is projected to capture a significant portion of the market currently underserved by existing methods. Initially targeting pallets, containers, and commercial vehicles, potential annual revenues of $10M+ are projected in the third year of production, paving the way for expansion into wider domestic and global markets. Ultimately, the technology is poised to be a key factor in enabling commercial success while offering societal benefits such as minimized disruption of production and improved food quality.

This Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) Phase I project seeks to provide technology for tracking reusable transports (e.g., pallets, containers, trailers, trucks) to reduce disruptions for manufacturers, movers, and package receivers by over 50%. Logistics operation inefficiencies in manufacturing, food distribution, and pharmaceutical delivery could be eliminated, reducing item journey monitoring costs and wasted time. The proposed devices will attach to pallets/containers, read passive RFIDs attached to serial numbered items, and communicate their location/state to a cloud based digital twin for each serial number. This will allow users to monitor products during shipping, updating product whereabouts, condition, and expected delivery timeline, boosting operational efficiency and product safety and creating the potential for circular logistics chains and goods that deliver themselves. This project will de-risk the device using evaluation hardware and demonstrate blink rate optimization feasibility, producing a prototype capable of transmitting and connecting to the monitoring software across various transportation types. The R&D will include reference design-based device testing focusing on battery longevity, chip power usage evaluation, and deployable antenna design for multi-item reads. The result will be an early prototype capable of being tested in an industrial pallet configuration for modular battery implementation in post-Phase I efforts.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

por.por_cntn:
Project Overview, Outcomes, and Findings

This Phase I project successfully demonstrated the feasibility of solving logistics control challenges using modern IoT technologies, proving concept on a novel combination of passive RFID (Radio Frequency Identification), UWB (Ultra-Wideband), and cellular technology. The innovation, PRhobe RIoT, is designed to significantly reduce disruptions in logistics by over 50%, providing a real-time tracking system with unparalleled granularity, accuracy, actionability, and efficiency.

By integrating low-power tracking and advanced asset monitoring capabilities, the RIoT system offers a cost-effective and highly scalable solution for logistics, supply chain management, and asset security. The Phase I project not only validated the technical feasibility but also confirmed the commercial viability of this approach, paving the way for Phase II productization and large-scale deployment. The project demonstrated that the RIoT system is technically and commercially viable, achieving all Phase I milestones. Key advancements include:

 

Low-Power Cellular & UWB Tracking:

• The Cellular chipset was selected for its 3x longer battery life than alternatives, ensuring sustained tracking.

• The system supports 2 cellular updates per day (stationary) or 1 per hour (moving) with a 10-year battery life.

 

Passive RFID Integration for Serial-Number-Level Visibility:

• Passive RFID enables tracking at the pallet and item level, with the indicative potential to offer more than 25x reduction in labor costs for logistics tracking.

• Testing confirmed high detection accuracy, even in occluded conditions (e.g., when located inside trucks, containers, and warehouses and with passive RFID-labelled items such as water bottles).

 

Ultra-Wideband (UWB) for Precision Locationing:

• UWB tracking achieved real-time indoor asset tracking with a battery-efficient 1Hz blink rate lasting for up to 10 years.

• The technology ensures accurate locationing of pallets, high-value goods, and medical/pharmaceutical products within manufacturing and distribution premises.

 

Prototyping and Commercialization Progress:

• A working prototype was successfully demonstrated, integrating RFID, UWB, and cellular technology.

• Key customers from beachhead market, including Automotive manufacturers, Logistics Software Vendors, Inventory Control Software & Service Vendors, Contract Manufacturers, Home Moving companies, Restaurants and Food Distributors, Supermarkets and logistics automation innovators expressed strong interest in piloting the technology.

 

Broader Impacts:

Transforming Logistics & Sustainability. the RIoT system has the potential to revolutionize global logistics, impacting multiple industries:

Reducing Supply Chain Waste. By providing real-time visibility into asset location and condition, RIoT reduces shrinkage, theft, and misplacement, cutting down unnecessary replacements and shipments.

Environmental & Sustainability Benefits. By preventing lost or misrouted goods, RIoT helps reduce inefficient transportation. Moreover, passive RFID tracking supports the circular economy by enabling reuse and better inventory planning.

Improved Healthcare & Food Safety: RIoT ensures equitable and timely distribution of critical goods, including pharmaceuticals and perishable food items. The system also supports pre-delivery failure alerts, ensuring products reach the right place in the right condition.

Economic & Industry Impact. By enabling real-time tracking at the item level, RIoT empowers businesses to cut costs, optimize supply chains, and improve service reliability. The technology supports smarter logistics software integrations, garnering partnerships with leading platforms, as potential resellers.

 

Next Steps & Phase II Goals:

With Phase I successfully completed, Phase II will focus on: Scaling the RIoT system for mass production and commercialization; expanding pilot programs with industry leaders; refining energy harvesting to extend the battery life beyond 10 years; developing additional algorithms for real-time theft prevention, inventory tracking, and route optimization. The success of this Phase I project positions RIoT as a game-changer in logistics, offering unparalleled efficiency, cost savings, and sustainability benefits. Indeed, Phase I research demonstrated both technical and commercial feasibility, surpassing original proposal expectations. With strong early interest from logistics leaders, PRhobe is well-positioned to bring economically viable serial-numbered tracking to the global supply chain. This breakthrough technology will simultaneously streamline logistics, enhance efficiency, ultimately transforming how businesses track, manage, and secure their assets worldwide.
